He began his career at [[FSV Mainz 05|Mainz 05]] in 2009, spending two years at the club before a £6.5 million transfer to [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen]]. His performances there gained the attention of [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], who signed him for a reported £18 million in 2013. Schürrle played one-and-a-half [[Premier League]] seasons at the English club before joining [[VfL Wolfsburg]] for £22 million in January 2015, winning the [[DFB-Pokal]] and [[DFL-Supercup]] in his first year. Schürrle has been a full international for Germany since 2010, gaining over 50 caps and scoring 20 goals. He was a member of the German squads which reached the semi-finals at [[UEFA Euro 2012]] and won the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]]. During extra-time in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final]] he provided the assist for [[Mario Götze]]'s winning goal against [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]]. ==Club career== ===Early career=== Schürrle started his career at local club Ludwigshafener SC at age four, before joining [[1. FSV Mainz 05]] in 2006. He played as a defender before switching to his current position of an attacker.{{cite news |title=Teenage Kicks: Andre Schurrle |url=https://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2015/01/teenage-kicks--andre-schurrle.html |work=Chelseafc.com |date=14 January 2015 |accessdate=10 June 2017}} He spent three years playing for the club's youth teams, where he won the [[Under 19 Bundesliga]] in 2009 under coach [[Thomas Tuchel]].{{cite news |title=Thomas Tuchel's carnival club party on as Mainz maintain perfect start |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2010/sep/23/thomas-tuchel-mainz-bundesliga |work=The Guardian |date=23 September 2010 |accessdate=10 June 2017}} ===1. FSV Mainz 05=== In August 2009, Schürrle made his [[Bundesliga]] debut in a 2–2 draw against [[Bayer 04 Leverkusen|Bayer Leverkusen]] on the opening day of the [[2009–10 Bundesliga|2009–10 season]].{{cite web | url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=ger/news/newsid=1531919.html | title=Schürrle opts for Leverkusen | publisher=UEFA.com | date=16 September 2010 | accessdate=20 May 2011}} The following month, on 19 September 2009, Schürrle scored his first two league goals in a 3–2 away win against [[VfL Bochum]] before signing a professional contract with the club later in the week.{{cite web | url=http://www.spiegel.de/sport/fussball/0,1518,650829,00.html | title=Kurzpässe: Auslosungsmodus der WM-Playoffs unklar, Kuranyi krank | language=German | publisher=Spiegel Online | date=23 September 2009 | accessdate=19 May 2011}} In September 2010, Mainz announced that Schürrle had signed a five-year contract with Bayer Leverkusen, and would join the club at the end of the [[2010–11 Bundesliga|2010–11 season]]. The transfer fee agreed between the two clubs was believed to be in the region of €8 million. ===Bayer Leverkusen=== Schürrle completed his £6.5 million move to Bayer Leverkusen in 2011,{{cite web|url=http://bleacherreport.com/articles/1173062-chelsea-transfer-rumours-who-is-andre-schurrle |title=Chelsea Transfer Rumours: Who Is Andre Schurrle? |publisher=Bleacher Report |date=5 May 2012 |accessdate=4 July 2013 }} signing a five-year contract with the club until the summer of 2016.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22219166 |title=Andre Schurrle: Chelsea hold transfer talks, say Leverkusen |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 April 2013 |accessdate=4 July 2013 }} He scored on his debut in a [[2011–12 DFB-Pokal|DFB Pokal]] tie against [[SG Dynamo Dresden|Dynamo Dresden]]. He had to wait until 15 October 2011 to open his Bundesliga account for Bayer Leverkusen, when he netted a late equalizer against [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]], rescuing his side a point as the match finished 2–2.{{cite web|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/1-bundesliga/2011-12/9/1143367/spielanalyse_borussia-mgladbach-15_bayer-leverkusen-9.html |title=Schürrle rettet Bayer einen Zähler |publisher=kicker |date=15 October 2011 |accessdate=4 July 2013 |language=German }} Schürrle registered his first European goal in the [[2011–12 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] in a home win over [[Valencia CF|Valencia]] four days later.{{cite web | url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2012/clubs/player=250005337/profile/index.html | title=Club History | publisher=UEFA.com}}{{Dead link|date=March 2013}} On 26 September, Schürrle scored his first goal of the season against [[FC Augsburg]] in a 3–1 win.{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/en/report/346360/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |title=FC Augsburg 1–3 Bayer Leverkusen |publisher=ESPN FC |date=26 September 2012 |accessdate=26 September 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121010033329/http://espnfc.com/en/report/346360/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |archivedate=10 October 2012 |df=dmy }} In the fixture against [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] on 28 October 2012, Schürrle provided an assist for [[Stefan Kießling]] in a 2–1 win at the [[Allianz Arena]]. This gave Bayern their first loss of the season in the Bundesliga and gave Bayer Leverkusen their first victory in Munich since October 1989.{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/en/report/346323/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |title=Leverkusen shock Bayern |publisher=ESPN FC |date=28 October 2012 |accessdate=28 October 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130219072808/http://espnfc.com/en/report/346323/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |archivedate=19 February 2013 |df=dmy }} On 30 March 2013, Schürrle scored twice in the match against [[Fortuna Düsseldorf]], in a 4–1 win.{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/en/gamecast/346161/gamecast.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |title=Leverkusen beat Düsseldorf |publisher=ESPN FC |date=30 March 2013 |accessdate=30 March 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130406185931/http://espnfc.com/en/gamecast/346161/gamecast.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |archivedate=6 April 2013 |df=dmy }} On 20 April 2013, Schürrle scored a brace and made an assist as they defeated [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|1899 Hoffenheim]] 5–0 at home.{{cite web|url=http://espnfc.com/en/report/346141/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |title=Schurrle bags brace |publisher=ESPN FC |date=20 April 2013 |accessdate=20 April 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130513123106/http://espnfc.com/en/report/346141/report.html?soccernet=true&cc=null |archivedate=13 May 2013 |df=dmy }} Schürrle finished the 2012–13 campaign with a tally of 14 goals and 9 assists in 43 games across all competitions.{{cite web | url = http://www.ibtimes.com/chelsea-transfer-news-cavani-bale-hulk-schurrle-linked-blues-1285493 | title= Chelsea Transfer News: Cavani, Bale, Hulk And Schurrle Linked To The Blues | publisher=ESPN FC | date= 30 May 2013 | accessdate = 30 May 2013 | first = Jason | last = Le Miere}} ===Chelsea=== [[File:André Schürrle'14.JPG|thumb|upright|Schürrle playing for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in 2013]] On 18 April 2013, it was confirmed that Bayer Leverkusen's director of sport [[Rudi Völler]] had travelled to [[London]] to hold talks with [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] over the transfer of Schürrle, although no fee had yet been agreed.{{cite web | url= http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11668/8650869/German-side-Bayer-Leverkusen-confirm-talks-in-London-about-Andre-Schurrle | title = German side Bayer Leverkusen confirm talks in London about Andre Schurrle | publisher=skysports.com| date= 19 April 2013 | accessdate = 29 May 2013 | first = Graeme | last = Bailey}} On 13 June 2013, Chelsea confirmed via their official website that they had reached an agreement with Leverkusen for the transfer of Schürrle,{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3208938/title/agreement-reached-for-transfer-of-andre-schurrle |title=Agreement reached for transfer of andre schurrle |publisher=chelseafc.com |date=13 June 2013 |accessdate=13 June 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130613123939/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3208938/title/agreement-reached-for-transfer-of-andre-schurrle |archivedate=13 June 2013 |df=dmy }} with the transfer fee reported to be in the region of €21 million (£18 million).{{cite web | url= http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2340971/Andre-Schurrle-joins-Chelsea-18m-Bayer-Leverkusen.html | title = Mourinho makes Schurrle his first signing as German seals £18 million move to Chelsea | publisher=DailyMail.co.uk | date = 13 June 2013 | accessdate = 13 June 2013 | first = John | last = Edwards}}{{cite web | url= http://prosoccertalk.nbcsports.com/2013/06/13/andre-schurrle-is-jose-mourinhos-first-signing-as-new-chelsea-manager | title = André Schürrle is Jose Mourinho’s first signing as new Chelsea manager | publisher=NBCSports.com| date= 13 June 2013 | accessdate = 13 June 2013}} On 25 June 2013, Chelsea announced that they had completed the transfer of Schürrle, bringing an end to the Londoners' protracted pursuit of the German forward. With Schürrle signing a five-year contract, he was given the number 14 shirt.{{cite web | url= http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3219878/title/schurrle-signing-completed | title= Schurrle signing completed | publisher=chelseafc.com | date = 25 June 2013 | accessdate = 25 June 2013}} On 4 August, Schürrle scored his first goal in a Chelsea shirt in a pre-season friendly match against [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] during a tour of the United States.{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3338450/title/schurrle-really-nice-feeling |title=Schurrle: really nice feeling |publisher=chelseafc.com |date=5 August 2013 |accessdate=5 August 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130808155701/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3338450/title/schurrle-really-nice-feeling |archivedate=8 August 2013 |df=dmy }} On 18 August, Schürrle made his competitive debut for Chelsea, coming on as a 67th-minute substitute for [[Kevin De Bruyne]] in a [[Premier League]] 2–0 win over [[Hull City F.C.|Hull City]] at [[Stamford Bridge (stadium)|Stamford Bridge]].{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3365344/title/match-report-chelsea-2-hull-city-0 |title=Match report: chelsea 2 hull city 0 |publisher=chelseafc.com |date=18 August 2013 |accessdate=18 August 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130819041407/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3365344/title/match-report-chelsea-2-hull-city-0 |archivedate=19 August 2013 |df=dmy }} His first goal for Chelsea came in the 2–1 home victory over title challengers [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on 27 October, where he scored from a cross by teammate [[Fernando Torres]].{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/10407601/Chelsea-2-Manchester-City-1-match-report.html |title=Chelsea 2 Manchester City 1: match report |publisher=The Telegraph |date=27 October 2013 |accessdate=27 October 2013 }} On 7 December, he then scored two goals against [[Stoke City]] in a 3–2 defeat.{{cite web|url=http://kr.chelseafc.com/chelsea-article/article/3566499 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20150118045552/http://kr.chelseafc.com/chelsea-article/article/3566499 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=18 January 2015 |title=MATCH REPORT: STOKE CITY 3 CHELSEA 2 |publisher=Chelseafc.com |date=7 December 2013 |accessdate=11 January 2015 }} Schürrle scored his first [[List of Premier League hat-tricks|Premier League hat-trick]] the following 1 March, against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] in a 3–1 away victory in the [[West London derby]].{{cite web|title=Andre Schurrle's hat-trick sees Chelsea beat Fulham 3–1|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/287558/report|publisher=Sky Sports News | date = 1 March 2014 | accessdate = 11 January 2015}} Three weeks later, he assisted [[Samuel Eto'o]]'s goal in the fifth minute and sent Chelsea into a 2–0 lead in the seventh minute at home to Arsenal; he was awarded Man of the match after Chelsea won 6–0.{{cite web|title= Premier League: Chelsea destroy 10-man Arsenal 6-0 as referee blunders |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/287588/report|publisher=Sky Sports News | date = 23 March 2014 | accessdate = 11 January 2015 | first = Rob | last = Parrish}} On 8 April, he scored in Chelsea's second leg [[UEFA Champions League]] match against [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|Paris Saint-Germain]], to advance to the semi-finals on the away-goals rule.{{cite web | url = http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/310247 | title = Champions League: Demba Ba's late goal sends Chelsea through against Paris St-Germain | publisher = Sky Sports News | date = 9 April 2014 | accessdate = 11 January 2015 | first = Rob | last = Parrish}} His first season in England ended with eight goals in 30 Premier League matches. On 18 August 2014, in Chelsea's first game of the new league season, Schürrle scored the second goal of a 3–1 victory away to [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], from a [[Cesc Fàbregas]] pass.{{cite news|title=Burnley 1–3 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28735901|accessdate=18 August 2014|work=[[BBC Sport]]|date=18 August 2014}} This was later voted ''[[Match of the Day]]''{{'}}s goal of the month.{{cite web | url = http://weaintgotnohistory.sbnation.com/2014/9/15/6153667/bbc-motd-goal-of-the-month-andre-schurrle-vs-burnley | title = BBC MotD Goal of the Month: Andre Schurrle vs. Burnley | publisher = weaintgotnohistory.sbnation.com | date = 15 September 2014 | accessdate = 11 January 2015 | first = David | last = Pasztor}} Chelsea finished the season as Premier League champions and Schürrle, despite going on to complete a transfer to Wolfsburg in early 2015, received a medal, having played 14 matches in the league season. He was not aware that he had played enough matches to earn a medal, and was surprised when manager [[José Mourinho]] texted him to tell him of the recognition.{{cite news|title=Andre Schurrle: Jose Mourinho texted me to say I'd won the title|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32740747|accessdate=14 May 2015|work=BBC Sport|date=14 May 2015}} ===Wolfsburg=== [[File:Emirates Cup - Arsenal v Wolfsburg (20012494129) (cropped) Andre Schürrle.jpg|thumb|upright|Schürrle playing for [[VfL Wolfsburg|Wolfsburg]] in 2015]] {{quote| You have to make a decision, and in the end I only wanted to play football again. Germany manager [[Joachim Löw]] told me it would be a great move for me and that is why Wolfsburg are a step forward for me. Wolfsburg have a great team as well and can play for silverware in the Bundesliga and in Europe.|Schürrle, on his transfer to Wolfsburg, in 2015.{{cite web|title=Mourinho wanted me to stay at Chelsea - Schurrle|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/15/germany/2015/02/18/9034142/mourinho-wanted-me-to-stay-at-chelsea-schurrle|date=18 February 2015|accessdate=18 February 2015}}}} On 2 February 2015, Schürrle returned to the Bundesliga, joining [[VfL Wolfsburg|Wolfsburg]] for a fee of £22 million.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31087979 |title=Andre Schurrle: Chelsea forward completes £22m Wolfsburg move |date=13 August 2010 |accessdate=2 February 2015 |work=BBC}} Five days later he made his debut for the club, playing the entirety of a 3–0 home win over [[TSG Hoffenheim|Hoffenheim]] and setting up goals for [[Bas Dost]] and [[Kevin De Bruyne]].{{cite news|last1=Banerjee|first1=Rohan|title=Andre Schurrle shines on Wolfsburg debut alongside fellow former Chelsea winger Kevin de Bruyne as they cruise to win over Hoffenheim|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2944051/Andre-Schurrle-shines-Wolfsburg-debut-alongside-fellow-former-Chelsea-winger-Kevin-Bruyne-cruise-win-Hoffenheim.html|accessdate=8 February 2015|work=[[Daily Mail]]|date=7 February 2015}} His first goal for the club came on 4 April, in a 3–1 win over [[VfB Stuttgart]].{{cite news|last1=Gill|first1=Kieran|title=Andre Schurrle relieved to score first goal for Wolfsburg after goal drought was 'eating away' at the former Chelsea forward|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3026454/Andre-Schurrle-relieved-score-goal-Wolfsburg-goal-drought-eating-away-former-Chelsea-forward.html|accessdate=7 April 2015|work=Daily Mail|date=4 April 2015}} On 30 May, Wolfsburg won the [[DFB-Pokal]] for the first time after beating [[Borussia Dortmund]] 3–1 in [[2015 DFB-Pokal Final|the final]] at the [[Olympiastadion (Berlin)|Olympiastadion]] in Berlin, Schürrle playing the final nine minutes in place of [[Maximilian Arnold]].{{cite news|title=Dortmund 1-3 Wolfsburg: DFB-Pokal won by De Bruyne and Dost|url=http://www.goal.com/en-gb/match/borussia-dortmund-vs-wolfsburg/1683489/report|accessdate=30 May 2015|work=Goal.com|date=30 May 2015}} Schürrle was a 63rd-minute substitute for [[Daniel Caligiuri]] as Wolfsburg won the [[2015 DFL-Supercup]] on 1 August, scoring in the [[penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalty shootout]].{{cite news|last1=Dunbar|first1=Ross|title=Bendtner leads Wolfsburg over Bayern Munich on penalties in German Super Cup clash|url=http://www.foxsports.com/soccer/story/bendtner-leads-wolfsburg-over-bayern-munich-on-penalties-in-german-super-cup-clash-080115?vid=null|accessdate=3 August 2015|publisher=Fox Sports|date=1 August 2015}} On 25 November, after again replacing Caligiuri in the 61st minute, he scored both goals in a Champions League [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League group stage|group stage]] win at [[PFC CSKA Moscow|CSKA Moscow]].{{cite news|last1=Gadd|first1=Michael|title=CSKA Moscow 0-2 Wolfsburg: Super-sub Andre Schurrle strikes twice to eliminate Russians from Champions League|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3333956/CSKA-Moscow-0-2-Wolfsburg-Super-sub-Andre-Schurrle-strikes-twice-eliminate-Russians-Champions-League.html|accessdate=25 November 2015|work=Daily Mail|date=25 November 2015}} On 1 March 2016, exactly two years after scoring his first club [[hat-trick]] for Chelsea, Schürrle recorded his first treble for Wolfsburg in their 4–0 win against [[Hannover 96]].{{cite news|title=Super Tuesday for Kenedy, Schürrle and Atlético|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=2338298.html|accessdate=3 March 2016|publisher=UEFA|date=1 March 2016}} A week later he scored the only goal in a 1–0 (4–2 aggregate) win over Belgian side [[K.A.A. Gent|Gent]] to advance his team to the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League quarter-finals]] for the first time in their history.{{Cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/uefa-champions-league/match/439167/vfl-wolfsburg-kaa-gent/report|title=Andre Schurrle scores as Wolfsburg advance past Gent|website=ESPNFC.com|access-date=2016-03-08}} ===Borussia Dortmund=== On 22 July 2016, Schürrle joined [[Borussia Dortmund]] for an undisclosed fee.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36864010|title=André Schürrle: Borussia Dortmund sign Wolfsburg winger|newspaper=BBC|access-date=22 July 2016}}{{cite web|url=http://www.bvb.de/eng/News/Overview/Borussia-Dortmund-sign-Andre-Schuerrle|title=Borussia Dortmund sign André Schürrle|website=Borussia Dortmund official website|access-date=22 July 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.vfl-wolfsburg.de/en/info/news/detailspage/artikel/bvb-bound-43298.html|title=BVB bound|website=VfL Wolfsburg official website|access-date=22 July 2016}} On 14 August 2016, Schürrle made his debut coming off the bench in 2–0 defeat against [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] in the [[2016 DFL-Supercup|DFL-Supercup]].{{cite web|url=https://www.dfb.de/supercup/spielplan/?spieledb_path=%2Fmatches%2F2234139 |title=Deutscher Supercup, 2016, Finale |date=14 August 2016}} ==== Fulham (loan) ==== On 25 July 2018, [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] announced the signing of Schürrle on a two season loan.{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/FulhamFC/status/1022213648763170816|title=Fulham Football Club on Twitter: "Welcome to Fulham Football Club, @Andre_Schuerrle!"|work=Twitter|accessdate=25 July 2018}} On 26 August, Schürrle scored his first goal for the club in a 4–2 victory over [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/55/main/2018/08/26/47310392/fulham-4-burnley-2-mitrovic-brace-helps-cottagers-get-off|title=Fulham 4 Burnley 2: Mitrovic brace helps Cottagers get off the mark|publisher=Goal.com|accessdate=27 August 2018}} ==International career== [[File:Andre Schürrle, Germany national football team (04).jpg|thumb|upright|Schürrle playing for [[Germany national football team|Germany]] in 2011]] ===Youth team=== Schürrle made his debut in a [[UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship]] qualifying match against [[Luxembourg national football team|Luxembourg]], which resulted in a 3–0 win.{{citation needed|date=April 2014}} After impressing for [[1. FSV Mainz 05]] in the [[Bundesliga]] he was called up to the [[Germany national under-21 football team|under-21 team]] in 2009.{{citation needed|date=April 2014}} ===Senior team=== In November 2010, Schürrle received a call up to the [[Germany national football team|senior team]].{{cite news | url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/international/l246w-caps-germanys-rising-stars-2130556.html | title=Löw caps Germany's rising stars | publisher=The Independent | date = 11 November 2010 | accessdate = 19 May 2011 | first = David | last = Plummer}} He subsequently made his debut in a friendly against [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]], appearing as a substitute in the 79th minute. Schürrle and [[Mario Götze]], who came on simultaneously, were the first two German international players to be born in [[German reunification|reunified Germany]].{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/preview?id=299387&cc=5739 |title=Kazakhs seek damage limitation against Germany |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |date=26 March 2011 |accessdate=19 May 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121102072517/http://soccernet.espn.go.com/preview?id=299387 |archivedate=2 November 2012 }} On 29 May 2011, Schürrle scored his first goal for the senior team, during a friendly against [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]] in a 2–1 win.{{cite web | url = http://www.uefa.com/friendlies/season=2012/matches/round=2000293/match=2007928/index.html | title = Germany get better of Uruguay again | publisher = UEFA.com | date = 29 May 2011 | accessdate = 30 March 2013}} Schürrle was chosen in Germany's squad for their [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying|qualification]] for [[UEFA Euro 2012]]. He scored against [[Azerbaijan national football team|Azerbaijan]] in a 3–1 win, on 7 June 2011.{{cite web | url = http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15171/match=2002135/index.html | title = Gomez strikes in Azerbaijan as Germany march on | publisher = UEFA.com | date = 7 June 2011 | accessdate = 30 March 2013}} On 2 September 2011, he scored again in the 6–2 thrashing victory over Austria,{{cite web | url = http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15171/match=2002111/index.html | title = Germany stroll past Austria to reach EURO 2012 | publisher = UEFA.com | date = 2 September 2011 | accessdate = 30 March 2013}} in both cases coming on as a substitute. In the next qualification fixture against [[Belgium national football team|Belgium]] on 11 October 2011, Schürrle was rewarded with his first start in the Euro 2012 qualifiers, and scored in the 33rd minute chipping over [[Simon Mignolet]].{{cite web | url = http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15171/match=2002112/index.html | title = Germany stamp out Belgium's fire | publisher = UEFA.com | date = 11 October 2011 | accessdate = 30 March 2013}} After scoring three times during the campaign as Germany won ten out of ten games to top their [[UEFA Euro 2012 qualifying Group A|group]] in their qualifiers, Schürrle was named in the Germany 23-man squad for [[UEFA Euro 2012]] and was given the number nine shirt. He made his first appearance at Euro 2012 on 17 June, coming on as a substitute in the 64th minute for [[Lukas Podolski]], in the 2–1 win over [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]].{{cite web | url = http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2012/matches/round=15172/match=2003338/postmatch/report/index.html | title = German joy signals despair for Denmark | publisher = UEFA.com | date = 17 June 2012 | accessdate = 30 March 2013}} On 15 October 2013, Schürrle scored a hat-trick in a 5–3 away win against [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]] in [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification (UEFA)|2014 FIFA World Cup qualification]].{{cite news|title=World Cup qualifiers: Germany end campaign with 5–3 win over Sweden|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/253857/report|accessdate=17 June 2014|work=[[Sky Sports News]]|date=15 October 2013}} Schürrle was named in Germany's squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/germany/10810439/Germany-World-Cup-2014-squad.html|title=Germany World Cup 2014 squad|date=2 June 2014|accessdate=22 June 2014|work=The Telegraph}} He made his [[FIFA World Cup]] debut as a substitute in the team's opening match, a 4–0 victory over [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/25285106|title=Germany 4–0 Portugal|date=16 June 2014|accessdate=22 June 2014|work=BBC | first = David | last = Ornstein}} In the 2–1 victory over [[Algeria national football team|Algeria]] in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage#Round of 16|round of 16]], Schürrle came on for Götze as a half-time substitute and scored the opening goal of the match in the second minute of [[extra time]].{{cite news|last =Ornstein|first =David|title=Germany 2–1 Algeria|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27969924|accessdate=30 June 2014|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=30 June 2014}} On 8 July, he scored Germany's final two goals after replacing [[Miroslav Klose]] as a 58th-minute substitute in a [[Mineirazo|7–1 semi-final victory]] over [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28102403|title=Brazil 1–7 Germany|date=8 July 2014|accessdate=9 July 2014|work=BBC | first = Phil | last = McNulty}} Schürrle again came on as a substitute in [[2014 FIFA World Cup Final|the final]] against [[Argentina national football team|Argentina]], replacing the injured [[Christoph Kramer]] in the first half. He provided the cross for Götze's winning goal in the 113th minute, as Germany won its fourth World Cup.{{cite news|last =McNulty|first =Phil|title=Germany 1–0 Argentina|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28181689|work=[[BBC Sport]]|date=13 July 2014 | accessdate = 11 January 2015}} During [[UEFA Euro 2016 qualification|qualification]] for [[UEFA Euro 2016]], Schürrle scored a hat-trick in a 7–0 away win over [[Gibraltar national football team|Gibraltar]] on 13 June 2015.{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/33122742|title=Armenia 2-3 Portugal|date=14 June 2015|work=BBC}} ==Playing style== Schürrle usually plays as a winger but naturally positioned as a second striker.{{cite news|last=Dunbar|first=Ross|title=Chelsea target Andre Schürrle scouting report: All you need to know about the Germany star|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/chelsea-target-andre-schrrle-scouting-1835452|accessdate=6 May 2013|newspaper=The Mirror|date=1 May 2013}} One of Schürrle's "key assets" is his "long-distance sprinting on the counter-attack." Schürrle also has an excellent fitness level, work-rate and pace. Schürrle is considered to be a "good finisher" and "capable of executing counter-attacks effectively". He often likes to cut inside, shoot from distance and enjoys time on the ball.{{cite web|title=André Schürrle |url=http://www.whoscored.com/Players/77461|website=whoscored.com | accessdate = 11
